metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9815 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
In LibTIFF 4.0.7, the TIFFReadDirEntryLong8Array function in libtiff/tif_dirread.c mishandles a malloc operation, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service (memory leak within the function _TIFFmalloc in tif_unix.c) via a crafted file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9815` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.3
libtiff-tools - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.3
libtiff5 - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.3
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> If this actually leaks only the 8 bytes shown in the bug then this cve should be rejected. I'm marking it 'low' rather than 'negligible' just so that we eventually return to the bug and see the results. mdeslaur> same commit as CVE-2017-9403 this will not be fixed in precise/esm

criterions.comment: tiff package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.6-1ubuntu0.3').
